overview:
Etienne is a startup CFO with deep technical background.

Etienne has founded or co-founded nearly a dozen start-ups at various stages of idea formation and funding and has mentored or advised entrepreneurs starting dozens more companies. He has been involved in analyzing business deals from $50,000 to $500 million and provides forecasting and CFO services for startups and growing companies seeking capital as founder of Next Exit Advisors. Now as CFO at The Paradigm Project, Etienne is developing sustainable business models for improving the lives of the worldâ€™s rural poorest while simultaneously protecting the environment and delivering solid returns to investors.

Etienne is a former board member for the Peak Venture Group where he co-founded and still manages the PVG Pitch Night, which has been initially successful in improving the entrepreneurial subculture of Colorado Springs.

Today, Etienne has three boys, was awarded 2012 Most Promising Social Entrepreneur in America (for The Paradigm Project) by BusinessWeek, 2011 Young Entrepreneur of the Year by the SBDC, 2011 Rising Star by the CSBJ, and one of the Top 25 Most Influential Young Professionals in Colorado by ColoradoBiz Magazine.
